items.headline: Bessent dismisses costs of tariffs, but says U.S. would have to give huge refunds if they’re overturned
items.summary_en: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Sunday said the U.S. could end up giving massive refunds if the U.S. Supreme Court finds the Trump administration’s tariffs are illegal, and denied that the tariffs are effectively a tax on American consumers.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Stock futures edge higher ahead of inflation reports, oil gains after OPEC+ raises output
items.summary_en: U.S. stock-market futures swung between slight gains and losses Sunday, as investors await key inflation reports later this week.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: After my father died, my stepsister transferred assets into her name. Do I have any legal recourse?
items.summary_en: “Since my dad died, I’ve been able to get just one box of personal mementos and some family possessions.”

items.headline: OPEC+ agrees to another oil production boost in October
items.summary_en: OPEC+ agreed Sunday to further increase oil production in October, in an ongoing move to regain market share at the expense of prices.

items.headline: Playboy secures big legal victory in China as it seeks to turn its fortunes around
items.summary_en: The long-running media and lifestyle brand has secured a major legal victory in a bruising fight with its former biggest partner in China that had resulted in the loss of nearly two-thirds of the company’s licensing revenue.
